pull_request.title: MassMatrix3: helper functions for simple shapes

pullrequest.title: MassMatrix3: helper functions for simple shapes

content.raw:
I separated them to avoid confusion about rotations. The `MassMatrix3` can tell you the rotation of the principal axes, but the inertial pose also can have a rotation. If you use the `MassMatrix3` class, then you know everything is computed at the center of mass.

Also, there are some operations that make sense for the `Inertial` class, but not `MassMatrix3`, such as the addition operator (7e922fa), and I wanted to give some separation
content.html:
I separated them to avoid confusion about rotations. The MassMatrix3 can tell you the rotation of the principal axes, but the inertial pose also can have a rotation. If you use the MassMatrix3 class, then you know everything is computed at the center of mass.

Also, there are some operations that make sense for the Inertial class, but not MassMatrix3, such as the addition operator (7e922fa), and I wanted to give some separation

content.raw: Oh yes, that makes sense, I had forgot about the Inertial class. To be honest it's not very clear to me why MassMatrix and Inertial are in different classes
content.html: Oh yes, that makes sense, I had forgot about the Inertial class. To be honest it's not very clear to me why MassMatrix and Inertial are in different classes

pullrequest.title: MassMatrix3: helper functions for simple shapes

content.raw:
I added the following in [gazebo 6d0622ad8](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/commits/6d0622ad817b0db2bab29ab1d63d031dd03282f9)

~~~
gazebo::msgs::Inertial Convert(const ignition::math::MassMatrix3d &_matrix);
~~~

but we can only write one `ConvertIgn(msgs::Inertial)` function, and I'd prefer if it returned `ignition::math::Inertial` rather than `MassMatrix3d`, so I'm waiting for pull request #112 before writing the `ConvertIgn` function
content.html:
I added the following in gazebo 6d0622ad8

gazebo::msgs::Inertial Convert(const ignition::math::MassMatrix3d &_matrix);

but we can only write one ConvertIgn(msgs::Inertial) function, and I'd prefer if it returned ignition::math::Inertial rather than MassMatrix3d, so I'm waiting for pull request #112 before writing the ConvertIgn function

pull_request.title: MassMatrix3: helper functions for simple shapes

update.description:
This PR adds helper functions for setting a `MassMatrix3` object based on the geometry of some simple shapes (box, sphere, and cylinder aligned with z axis). There is also a function called `EquivalentBox` that returns the shape and orientation of a box with equivalent inertia to the current `MassMatrix3` object. Note that the orientation is not unique due to box symmetry.

This also includes a few small numerical enhancements to the `MassMatrix3` algorithms that have been split into pull request #109 to simplify the review process. The diff for this PR will be smaller after that one is merged.

If you want to test this pull request with gazebo, use [gazebo branch inertia_vis](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/compare/inertia_vis%0Dgazebo7), which uses these functions to rescale the inertia of simple shapes when the resize tool is used from the simulation window. It also replaces a few instances of inertia calculations.
update.title: MassMatrix3: helper functions for simple shapes
